learning_outcomes.description: Explain how geographical information is used to answer questions
Describe how spatial data is represented and organised in a GIS
Identify, interpret and apply methods for GIS data capture
Identify, interpret and apply methods for spatial data visualisation using GIS
Identify, interpret and apply methods for spatial data analysis using GIS
Identify, interpret and apply methods for decision-making using GIS
Integrate GIS methods to solve geographical problems
Evaluate GIS applications and approaches to plan and document GIS projects
Develop team building and teamwork skills during Group Work activities

assessments.task_description:
Short quiz completed within 6 of the practical labs. These encourage students to understand the theory and to prepare for GIS lab tasks. The aim is to make efficient use of time and to improve GIS learning. They are marked, and the best 5 out of 6 are used for the assessment grade.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Quiz will be opened at the start of the scheduled practical session and closes at the end. No late submission or extensions. Final mark for these assessments will be based on best 5 out of 6.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Practical exercises on geospatial concepts and GIS mapping skills to solve a practical problem. This assessment is based on lectures on GIS concepts and practical mapping outputs (weeks 1-4). It is comprised of:

i) A GIS map layout to visually assess a resource on UQ campus, i.e. locations for cafes, information directories.

ii) Higher-order thinking quiz questions on GIS concepts and principles from lectures and lab practicals, may also include some multiple-choice questions

The full requirements for the first task 'GIS map layout' are provided 2 weeks prior to due date.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The requirements for GIS map layout [item i] are typically available 2 weeks prior to due date, and Blackboard submission is opened 1 week prior to due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Practical exercises on geospatial analysis and GIS analysis skills to solve a practical problem. This assessment is based on lecture concepts and practical mapping outputs for weeks 5-8. It is comprised of:

i) The GIS risk analysis of flooding for the UQ campus. A report (based on a word template) is submitted which includes text, maps, tables and charts.

ii) Higher-order thinking quiz questions on GIS concepts and principles from lectures and lab practicals, and may also include some multiple-choice questions.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The requirements for GIS analysis report [item i] are typically available 2 weeks prior to due date, and Blackboard submission is opened 1 week prior to due date. Submitted online through Blackboard. Students need to store documentation for GIS tasks and retain a copy of submission. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The GIS project is based on a site visited in the field trip to evaluate physical site factors and allocate future land use options. The output is a group report (group size 2-3) where each member focuses on at least one objective and collaborate on overall project and land use allocation.

External students will be provided with resources to complete the assessment. A virtual field trip will be available.

Before submission a pre-completion meeting will be arranged that includes an individual question and answer session as a threshold check (e.g., confirming authorship and project understanding), but does not raise the grade beyond the written submission. This will include a 'group peer assessment task' which will be completed in Week 13 moderated as part of the pre-completion check.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submitted online through Blackboard. Students need to store documentation for GIS tasks and retain a copy of submission.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Day field trip for land use suitability study and stakeholder workshop

Day field trip associated with the GIS Project for a land use suitability study. The field trip visits sites and conducts workshops in areas close to the University. Participation is expected; students may request not to attend (given a valid reason) but will be given an alternative activity.

Learning outcomes: L03, L08
learning_activities.topic_title: Day field trip for land use suitability study and stakeholder workshop

The field trip visits sites and conducts workshops in areas close to the University. Participation is expected; students may request not to attend (given a valid reason) but will be given an alternative activity.
